title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A gripping tale of racial injustice and lost innocence in a small Southern town.

author: George Orwell
description: A chilling prophecy about the future and a warning about the dangers of totalitarianism.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A witty and romantic tale of love, marriage, and social class in Georgian England.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A critique of the American Dream set in the Jazz Age of the 1920s.

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: A young wizard discovers his magical heritage and begins his journey at Hogwarts School.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A controversial coming-of-age story about teenage rebellion and alienation.

title: Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic fantasy adventure following a hobbit's quest to destroy the One Ring.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: A sweeping space opera about politics, religion, and ecology on a desert planet.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
description: A haunting tale of a totalitarian society where women's rights have been stripped away.

title: Beloved
author: Toni Morrison
description: A powerful novel about the lasting trauma of slavery and the supernatural.
